column2: The finest knights of Araby, armed with an ornate arsenal they ride the finest steeds descended from Elven stock apparently.
Arabyans place great faith in the bow, and every Arabyan city maintains strong bodies of archers.
Dervishers are fanatical, religious warriors all too willing to die for their god.
These humble infantrymen form the solid foundation of any Arabyan army.
These soldiers are often individuals brought up and trained as warriors or guards.
Guards are well-equipped with steel armor, keen tulwars and fine silk clothing. The loyalty of these troops is famous and they are amply rewarded with riches, luxuries, and prestige as a result.
Lords of the Dune, many foes fall to furtive arrows before the rangers melt back into the sand.
It's said these spear-armed cavalrymen were born in the saddle making them a useful harrassing force against infantry and cavalry alike.
These nomadic horse archers can pepper an enemy before moving in for close-combat.
Scourge of the Great Ocean they plunder the shores of Tilea and Estalia with wanton abandon.
War elephants are a wave of flesh, unleashed against the unwary.
Hailing from the fetid jungles of the far south, these warriors are well acquainted with all manner of beast and monster.
Reared from hatchlings these dangerous creatures would be impossible to control without the aid of magic.
These fearsome beasts can trample men and horses into the dust.
Bought as slaves, and often trained from boyhood these soldiers make formidable opponents though their loyalty is naturally questionable.
Pit-Fighters were usually slaves, criminals or prisoners of war but freemen also enlisted in search of gold and glory. Superbly-trained heavy infantry with little fear of death.
Armed with long-barrelled arquebus of Arabyan design, the endless deserts have taught these men the value of marksmanship and an accurate firearm.
An ancient beast, harbinger of fiery doom bound to a Magician's service, whom are said to love the smell of naptha in the morning.
Overshadowed by their abominable undead cousins, they stike equal fear into their foes who meet claw and pincer.
Swift and deadly, they have a potent sting and powerful pincers that can slice a man in half.
The Ravager Elephant is said to rival those of Norsca's Mammoths
They follow the teachings of the talented and fanatical Wizard Mullah Aklan'd, honouring his name and hope to die gloriously so they can pass into the highest of the seven heavens St'oec.
Very heavily armoured and equipped with fine armaments, they are somewhat outdated and slow but are still formidable troops.
Armoured like turtles, brave as lions, with swords like wasp stings…
A famous mercenary band that hail from the arid-deserts of great Araby.
Jaguar Champions are fearsome nomads, who through great skill and courage are allowed to wear uniforms made from jaguar skins.
The Muktarhin are a near legendary warriors such is their repute even the infamous Al Muktar’s Desert Dogs carry the Black Banner of the Muktarhin wailing "Mighty are the Muktarhin!"

Made in an age long ago, this monstrous cannon is maintained by unnatural powers and is said to send its crew insane. This, coupled with the peoples hatred of gunpowder, has seen it hidden and disused for centuries.
The brutish ogres are a powerful ally to have on the battlefield, that is, until they flee at the first sign of trouble.
All is not what it seems...
These fearsome beasts have a small mounted cannon, a concept originating in the faraway lands of Ind.
